intro: Erodium chumbulense, commonly known as the Chumbul erodium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry environments, showcasing adaptations to arid conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Erodium chumbulense is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
